newsitem.title: PERU: Peru 56-day CDs draw 14.00 pct avg yield at sale.
newsitem.headline: Peru 56-day CDs draw 14.00 pct avg yield at sale.

text.p: The Central Reserve Bank of Peru said on Wednesday that it accepted bids for 56-day Certificates of Deposit (CDs) worth 60 million soles at an effective average annual rate of 14.00 percent during a bank auction.
The CDs have an October 3 starting date.
The accepted bids had a minimum rate of 14.00 percent and a maximum rate also of 14.00 percent, the bank said.
At the last auction on Tuesday, 42-day CDs drew an average yield of 14.00 percent.
At Wednesday's auction, the bank said it received bids on the CDs totalling 126.8 million soles.
The bank had offered 60 million soles worth of CDs.
The average effective annual interest rate for the certificates is used as an informal indicator for interest rates in the Peruvian financial system.
